name: Shiyu Chang
content: Shiyu Chang | UC Santa Barbara Shiyu Chang Associate Professor, Ph.D. UC Santa Barbara chang87 [AT] ucsb.edu Bio Shiyu Chang is an Associate Professor of Computer Science at UC Santa Barbara. His research focuses on machine learning, with applications in natural language processing and computer vision. Before joining UC Santa Barbara, Shiyu was a research scientist at the MIT-IBM Watson AI Lab, where he worked closely with Prof. Regina Barzilay and Prof. Tommi Jaakkola. He earned both his B.S. and Ph.D. from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. His Ph.D. advisor is Prof. Thomas S. Huang.
